*Solution?* Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKUâ€™s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO. 

**DERO Data Privacy** **+ Tokenization of Security**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**Worldâ€™s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> â€œCommunity Ownership of Physical and Digital Assetsâ€

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Macâ€™s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and itâ€™s production on-chain, from SKU NFTâ€™s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Macâ€™s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Macâ€™s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFTâ€™s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build â€œMetaverse farmsâ€ and â€œdigital dispensariesâ€ where a user can view the product, find out all of itâ€™s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, weâ€™ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Macâ€™s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting $HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKUâ€™s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephewâ€™s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities ProgramÂ to co-create $HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephewâ€™s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

title: HASH DAO ($HASH) Whitepaper
body:
*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission : Our mission is to cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.** 

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution forÂ craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOCÂ communitiesÂ interested in theÂ cannabis space.

HASHÂ DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of the blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's brand to create the worldâ€™s first Web3 Cannabis brand and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAOÂ Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**  

A successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal integrity struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

***Solution***

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating a decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

> **Opportunity**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering itâ€™s boom phase as more global cannabis markets arise and support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) continues to grow support, in 2020 alone the cannabis space grew to over [$200 Billion](https://www.marketwatch.com/story/cannabis-sector-could-grow-to-200-billion-in-a-decade-say-stifel-analysts-2019-07-02) and is projected to 10x in the next decade.

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

> **Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space**

Corporate cannabis companies operate and control the majority of the space, leaving legacy operators and small brands without capital solutions to scale their businesses and do not take into consideration all of itâ€™s stakeholders :

* The Growers & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/oXXVXLuIXOQoXtXRqzBXV.png?height=621&width=904)

The majority of the craft cannabis space, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the patient, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often donâ€™t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**HIGHLIGHT FRESH FROZEN PROBLEM**

![Exclusive Libraries of Genetics & Phenos](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-8T4OrLTcNOJxW2vLerl-.jpg?height=1866&width=1536)

*Solution?* Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKUâ€™s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO. 

**DERO Data Privacy** **+ Tokenization of Security**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)**

**Worldâ€™s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

> **HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M6C2p0sNHx37p783TEv9D.jpg?height=822&width=1125)

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> â€œCommunity Ownership of Physical and Digital Assetsâ€

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Macâ€™s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and itâ€™s production on-chain, from SKU NFTâ€™s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Macâ€™s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Macâ€™s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFTâ€™s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build â€œMetaverse farmsâ€ and â€œdigital dispensariesâ€ where a user can view the product, find out all of itâ€™s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, weâ€™ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Macâ€™s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting $HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKUâ€™s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephewâ€™s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities ProgramÂ to co-create $HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephewâ€™s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QcqQLT4DyBHuQRaaputgr.png?height=560&width=997)

title: HASH DAO ($HASH) Whitepaper
body:
*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission : Our mission is to cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.**

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution forÂ craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOCÂ communitiesÂ interested in theÂ cannabis space.

HASHÂ DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of the blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's brand to create the worldâ€™s first Web3 Cannabis brand and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAOÂ Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**

A successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal integrity struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

> *Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space*

Current Stakeholders in the Cannabis Space :

* The Growers & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

**Solution**

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

**Opportunity**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering itâ€™s boom phase as more global cannabis markets arise and support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) continues to grow support, in 2020 alone the cannabis space grew to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway.

The majority of the craft cannabis space, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the patient, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often donâ€™t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**HIGHLIGHT FRESH FROZEN PROBLEM**

![Exclusive Libraries of Genetics & Phenos](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-8T4OrLTcNOJxW2vLerl-.jpg?height=1866&width=1536)

*Solution?* Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKUâ€™s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO.

**DERO Data Privacy** **+ Tokenization of Security**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)**

**Worldâ€™s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

> **HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M6C2p0sNHx37p783TEv9D.jpg?height=822&width=1125)

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> â€œCommunity Ownership of Physical and Digital Assetsâ€

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Macâ€™s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and itâ€™s production on-chain, from SKU NFTâ€™s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Macâ€™s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Macâ€™s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFTâ€™s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build â€œMetaverse farmsâ€ and â€œdigital dispensariesâ€ where a user can view the product, find out all of itâ€™s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, weâ€™ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Macâ€™s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting $HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKUâ€™s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephewâ€™s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities ProgramÂ to co-create $HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephewâ€™s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QcqQLT4DyBHuQRaaputgr.png?height=560&width=997)

A successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal integrity struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering itâ€™s boom phase as more global cannabis markets arise and support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) continues to grow support, in 2020 alone the cannabis space grew to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway.

This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often donâ€™t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

title: Rethinking What To Sell: Books  as NFT in Web3 (Gumroad Alternatives)
body:
## Books: Evolution of What to Sell

Before the Internet, we sell papers. We buy books for its information, true; but we also sell the papers that captures that information we need. When internet became available, books become paperless (at least, for e-books), and we sell only its information. We could have physical guards guarding the shop, preventing people from reading inside the shop without buying. As for e-books, we have lots of locks (expiring PDFs, non-printable contents, format that requires special program to unlock first then read, etc) for gatekeeping its content. Now that information become decentralizes, itâ€™s time to re-think whether we should be selling something else, except for its information. 

Even physical books make changes. For example, one get to read books in a book store without buying it. Itâ€™s clear that, as long as we donâ€™t damage the book, people are free to read the information and only buy the papers as a collection. Libraries exist to allow people whom canâ€™t afford buying the book, or whom only needs the information (which they can finish reading real quick) for free. Then, internet libraries exist like Archive or OpenLibrary that either store a physical or electronic copies somewhere, bought from a store, and lend it for anyone with an account to borrow. Though with online libraries, to ensure it works like a real libraries, when someone is owning the copy for a period of time, others canâ€™t read. What we want, minimally, is something that all of us could read at once, transparently, but anyone could also buy and support the author as a collection. 

Letâ€™s look first at a hybrid solution, solving web2 problem using web3 solution, before moving on to re-think a **web3 problem** with a web3 solution. 

## Hybrid Web2-Web3 Book Store

Assuming we want to sell unlockable contents to users. Have you used OpenSea before? If no, try to become an author on NFT and create an NFT; youâ€™d see a field saying â€œunlockable contentsâ€ where its content is accessible only by NFT owners. Ultimately, these contents arenâ€™t store on blockchain; otherwise they would be transparent and viewable on the transaction receipts. NFT acts as a gateway, a key to access information stored on the database, linked via an id (token id). Similarly, you could see this as books sold: only people whom bought the NFT can access the bookâ€™s content, perhaps even downloading it. Like Amazon, we might have an open content in the description field of the NFT which contains a link to the sample content stored on some publicly-accessible storage providers (like IPFS). 

Though be aware: the reason blockchain is powerful is because of its transparency and immutability. As a hybrid solution to the web2 problem (gatekeeping of its contents), it makes sense to not use blockchain but just the crypto transactions capabilities to replace traditional bank transfers. In any sense, these are like Gumroad or Amazon marketplace. But why crypto transactions? First, author living in certain countries (like mine) cannot accept payment via PayPal and not eligible for direct bank transfer from Gumroad marketplace, so Gumroad is out! Amazon is really dark on its â€œroyaltiesâ€, where author only earn 35% of what they sell by default (70% in rare cases), which is just, dark. We want something that anyone could buy and sell anywhere (not just the 200+ countries supported by PayPal or other restrictions) where internet is available (no internet no blockchain sorry); and we want to pay the author more (**at least** 85% goes to the Author). That encourages a hybrid web2-web3 marketplace. 

So, instead of paying via bank transfer (which is annoying), we pay via crypto (one click to a few clicks approving transactions). And we just changed a method of gatekeeping. But we can do moreâ€¦

## What are we trying to solve here? 

Ultimately, a book is useful because of its information. From a traditional thinking, if we open up its content, itâ€™s not useful to buy books anymore. Author canâ€™t earn anything for their hard work if everyone could read it for free. But is that really true? Nope. Even in web2 world, there are lots of free information. We already mentioned one -- the library. Another one is pirating books. **A piece of information locked behind gates are doomed to be pirated**. Unless the bookâ€™s information is utterly useless; if itâ€™s something interesting, it certainly would get pirated some day later. The author might have earned enough before that, or even keeps earning; but that doesnâ€™t mean people whom canâ€™t afford it or not willing to pay wonâ€™t find a way to access the information. If thatâ€™s the case, why not open up the content and try selling something else? 

Letâ€™s take an example. This article is written on mirror.xyz, and Mirror offers anyone to write a blog post, an essay, or even a novel, and allow anyone online to read the information for free. Then, it could be minted as a paid resources, where people could collect the information and support the author. This provides a good starting point for how we can shape a book store marketplace with the blockchain: transparent content, with unique, limited collectibles. Similarly, if we take a look at other fields like Music: Music NFT now allows anyone to listen to musics, unrestricted to where youâ€™re located (my country cannot listen to Spotify without VPN); and someone could collect the music NFT to support its creator if they really love the music. **Again, free information, paid collectibles.** 

> Though, Iâ€™m not sure how you write a long novel here if your browser starts lagging trying to cache lots of information in a single page. 

Itâ€™s now clear that we want to open up its information, but to sell something else. Letâ€™s see some possibilities of how content creators could earn if they couldnâ€™t earn through information. 

## How can Authors Earn? 

Donâ€™t expect author to be charity. They also have their burdens that needs money. 

### A No No: Sponsorship System. 

Nope, its not sustainable. Thereâ€™s a reason why money flows in a closed loop: a large closed loop. A sponsorship system is like publish0x: publish0x tips both the author and the readers. It doesnâ€™t make sense, though. Platform needs to pay both author and readers, but receives nothing in return, and they also need to pay for storage, servers, etc. So, this depends on whether people will donate a large sum of money to keep them running. Whenever donation stops, their platform stops running. Its dependent on rich people to donate a portion of their wealth to the users of the platform. Its non sustainable in the long run, too dependent on a few entities. 

Money derives its value from peopleâ€™s needs and wants. A sponsorship system is either created by people to attract users to use its platform; or its created by people whom get confused by what blockchain tries to do. Blockchain tries to reward users for some of their actions that we see their **effort** in. They keyword is **effort**. Letâ€™s take a few yes and no. An author writing a blog takes effort. A content creator posting on web3 social media (like [noise.cash](https://noise.cash) or [Myriad Social](https://www.myriad.social)), and reward those that post with coins. But users whom donâ€™t contribute anything except for their time? No, they donâ€™t get rewarded. Instead, they are reading someone elseâ€™s information, it makes sense for them to tip the content creators for whatever information they receives that may help them to make money somewhere else; or perhaps that makes them enjoy themselves when they see a funny cat picture. Thinking of rewarding readers for their time is, in my opinion, a deviated view of what blockchain tries to achieve. A user **choose to** (their own choice) read the blog or look through their social media because they wish to relax or learn some information that they donâ€™t know before that. Since they receive something useful (information/emotional enhancement), they pay via token for those whom make their lives better in exchange. They need/want something, so they paid for what they need/what. 

> My fellow readers, you donâ€™t have to agree with me to continue reading. :) 

### Pre-Sale Benefits

Letâ€™s start with something easy. Those whom own NFTs via pre-sale could read the books 1 month before itâ€™s published to the general audience. Sounds good? Those whom bought the NFT can access a special page where they can watch videos/read books/listen to audiobooks. Or, if these are open (which most probably are, stored on IPFS), we could allow early birds to download the files and watch/read it offline. (Remember, itâ€™s gonna get pirated anyways, so downloading PDF doesnâ€™t need to be encrypted PDF or something). After early access, those people can still buy the NFT after general announcement, for other kinds of benefits. Then, people can read the content (and download the book) for free. ***What, you live on barely 5 dollars per day? Itâ€™s okay, forget about the 50+ USD textbooks that are non-affordable, we are free!***

### Additional Benefits

Owners of NFT also owns other benefits, depending on what author provides. For example, taken from learning platform EdX and Pluralsight, you can learn the content for free, but you pay to earn a certificate. Similarly, the certificate could be an NFT, and only owners whom subscribe for an NFT are eligible to take the exam. Or perhaps like language learning platforms, you could learn for free, but access to 1:1 teachings from professionals require payment. Here, owner of NFTs are eligible for 1:1 teachings. Whether or not to have tiers of NFT (like Common, Rare, Legendary) are optional depending on what the author provides. ***As information get unlocked, people earn by paying for othersâ€™ time and effort***.

### Extra Time for 1 on 1 (1:1)

Maybe still in a locking sense, people get access to the general book; but to access to authorâ€™s experiences on specific problems, whether by asking them 1:1 or author creates another handbook for that, requires an NFT. Itâ€™s what you noticed (â€œexperienceâ€ or â€œextra informationâ€) that makes you stand out of the crowd. While people more willingly share basic information, these stuffs that makes you stand out are more closed; and it makes sense for NFT holders to buy these experiences so author are more willing to share their expertise on specific problems. ***Basic information are free, while problem-specific experiences are what makes the differences***.

> Experiences can mean what you deliberately noticed. Read smartcuts Chapter 5 â€œWavesâ€ for more information.
>
> [https://openlibrary.org/works/OL17900734W/Smartcuts_how_hackers_innovators_and_icons_accelerate_success?edition=ia%3Asmartcutshowhack0000snow](https://openlibrary.org/works/OL17900734W/Smartcuts_how_hackers_innovators_and_icons_accelerate_success?edition=ia%3Asmartcutshowhack0000snow)


### Access to Discussion/Club/DAO

Or perhaps people get access to discussions. For example, some people doesnâ€™t agree with what the book said, and they have their own saying. If the book have a â€œdiscussionâ€ tab, NFT holders could commit their ideas. Together, they could update the book (with or without the author) to include stuffs the author missed, not aware of, or perhaps other discussions viewpoints. These could be open or closed, and NFT holders might, together with the author, release a v2 edition of the book after some issues not previously aware of in v1 edition are solved. Then, after v2 edition releases, those holding NFTs can get a split of whatâ€™s earned based on their contributions. ***NFT holders are like DAO members, where the DAO is that specific book rather than a general guild/group/community.***

> Though, whether or not this will â€œinflict some damageâ€ to the author is worth discussing. As in, does the author wants people to make change to their content? Or author have other concerns?

These are just a few. Who knows if you discover the next innovative solution?

## Conclusion

In conclusion, as information goes public, as gatekeepers fail to keep information behind gates, itâ€™s time to re-think what we sell. Instead of selling information, one could sell benefits that only book collectors have access to. Ultimately, we aim at provide access to correct, trustworthy information to the general public without worrying about money. We are both a library and a bookseller. People can choose to â€œborrowâ€ it from the library (read it for free), or they can â€œbuyâ€ a book that they read and goes into their shelf (collect an NFT) (with more benefits than just collecting, perhaps).

So, itâ€™s time to re-think.


---

## Extra: Why a Bookseller on Web3?

You may have noticed the hints one wrote while reading. First, one tries to sell book on Gumroad, unsuccessfully, because one cannot be paid by PayPal. Then, one tries to sell book on Amazon, and how dark is oneâ€™s face when one saw one could only earn 35% out of oneâ€™s book! Given the difficulty of being paid, itâ€™s time to move to cryptocurrency.

Initially, web3 comes as a side-product of these motivations. After starting oneâ€™s own development, one discovered lots of potential and drawbacks that, either we head butt through them, slicing through all the obstacles thatâ€™s on the way to get what we want from the beginning; or we re-think what we want. Honestly, one donâ€™t have the grit to head butt through, nor is one sure that head butt is the right solution; rethinking them seems to fare better, and perhaps provide a brighter future solution.

(this article may be updated in the future).

Itâ€™s clear that, as long as we donâ€™t damage the book, people are free to read the information and only buy the papers as a collection. Libraries exist to allow people whom canâ€™t afford buying the book, or whom only needs the information (which they can finish reading real quick) for free. Then, internet libraries exist like Archive or OpenLibrary that either store a physical or electronic copies somewhere, bought from a store, and lend it for anyone with an account to borrow. Though with online libraries, to ensure it works like a real libraries, when someone is owning the copy for a period of time, others canâ€™t read. What we want, minimally, is something that all of us could read at once, transparently, but anyone could also buy and support the author as a collection. 

Letâ€™s look first at a hybrid solution, solving web2 problem using web3 solution, before moving on to re-think a **web3 problem** with a web3 solution. 

## Hybrid Web2-Web3 Book Store

Assuming we want to sell unlockable contents to users. Have you used OpenSea before? If no, try to become an author on NFT and create an NFT; youâ€™d see a field saying â€œunlockable contentsâ€ where its content is accessible only by NFT owners. Ultimately, these contents arenâ€™t store on blockchain; otherwise they would be transparent and viewable on the transaction receipts. NFT acts as a gateway, a key to access information stored on the database, linked via an id (token id). Similarly, you could see this as books sold: only people whom bought the NFT can access the bookâ€™s content, perhaps even downloading it. Like Amazon, we might have an open content in the description field of the NFT which contains a link to the sample content stored on some publicly-accessible storage providers (like IPFS). 

Though be aware: the reason blockchain is powerful is because of its transparency and immutability. As a hybrid solution to the web2 problem (gatekeeping of its contents), it makes sense to not use blockchain but just the crypto transactions capabilities to replace traditional bank transfers. In any sense, these are like Gumroad or Amazon marketplace. But why crypto transactions? First, author living in certain countries (like mine) cannot accept payment via PayPal and not eligible for direct bank transfer from Gumroad marketplace, so Gumroad is out! Amazon is really dark on its â€œroyaltiesâ€, where author only earn 35% of what they sell by default (70% in rare cases), which is just, dark. We want something that anyone could buy and sell anywhere (not just the 200+ countries supported by PayPal or other restrictions) where internet is available (no internet no blockchain sorry); and we want to pay the author more (**at least** 85% goes to the Author). That encourages a hybrid web2-web3 marketplace. 

So, instead of paying via bank transfer (which is annoying), we pay via crypto (one click to a few clicks approving transactions). And we just changed a method of gatekeeping. But we can do moreâ€¦

## What are we trying to solve here? 

Ultimately, a book is useful because of its information. From a traditional thinking, if we open up its content, itâ€™s not useful to buy books anymore. Author canâ€™t earn anything for their hard work if everyone could read it for free. But is that really true? Nope. Even in web2 world, there are lots of free information. We already mentioned one -- the library. Another one is pirating books. **A piece of information locked behind gates are doomed to be pirated**. Unless the bookâ€™s information is utterly useless; if itâ€™s something interesting, it certainly would get pirated some day later. The author might have earned enough before that, or even keeps earning; but that doesnâ€™t mean people whom canâ€™t afford it or not willing to pay wonâ€™t find a way to access the information. If thatâ€™s the case, why not open up the content and try selling something else? 

Letâ€™s take an example. This article is written on mirror.xyz, and Mirror offers anyone to write a blog post, an essay, or even a novel, and allow anyone online to read the information for free. Then, it could be minted as a paid resources, where people could collect the information and support the author. This provides a good starting point for how we can shape a book store marketplace with the blockchain: transparent content, with unique, limited collectibles. Similarly, if we take a look at other fields like Music: Music NFT now allows anyone to listen to musics, unrestricted to where youâ€™re located (my country cannot listen to Spotify without VPN); and someone could collect the music NFT to support its creator if they really love the music. **Again, free information, paid collectibles.** 

> Though, Iâ€™m not sure how you write a long novel here if your browser starts lagging trying to cache lots of information in a single page. 

Itâ€™s now clear that we want to open up its information, but to sell something else. Letâ€™s see some possibilities of how content creators could earn if they couldnâ€™t earn through information. 

## How can Authors Earn? 

Donâ€™t expect author to be charity. They also have their burdens that needs money. 

### A No No: Sponsorship System. 

Nope, its not sustainable. Thereâ€™s a reason why money flows in a closed loop: a large closed loop. A sponsorship system is like publish0x: publish0x tips both the author and the readers. It doesnâ€™t make sense, though. Platform needs to pay both author and readers, but receives nothing in return, and they also need to pay for storage, servers, etc. So, this depends on whether people will donate a large sum of money to keep them running. Whenever donation stops, their platform stops running. Its dependent on rich people to donate a portion of their wealth to the users of the platform. Its non sustainable in the long run, too dependent on a few entities. 

Money derives its value from peopleâ€™s needs and wants. A sponsorship system is either created by people to attract users to use its platform; or its created by people whom get confused by what blockchain tries to do. Blockchain tries to reward users for some of their actions that we see their **effort** in. They keyword is **effort**. Letâ€™s take a few yes and no. An author writing a blog takes effort. A content creator posting on web3 social media (like [noise.cash](https://noise.cash) or [Myriad Social](https://www.myriad.social)), and reward those that post with coins. But users whom donâ€™t contribute anything except for their time? No, they donâ€™t get rewarded. Instead, they are reading someone elseâ€™s information, it makes sense for them to tip the content creators for whatever information they receives that may help them to make money somewhere else; or perhaps that makes them enjoy themselves when they see a funny cat picture. Thinking of rewarding readers for their time is, in my opinion, a deviated view of what blockchain tries to achieve. A user **choose to** (their own choice) read the blog or look through their social media because they wish to relax or learn some information that they donâ€™t know before that. Since they receive something useful (information/emotional enhancement), they pay via token for those whom make their lives better in exchange. They need/want something, so they paid for what they need/what. 

> My fellow readers, you donâ€™t have to agree with me to continue reading. :) 

### Pre-Sale Benefits

Letâ€™s start with something easy. Those whom own NFTs via pre-sale could read the books 1 month before itâ€™s published to the general audience. Sounds good? Those whom bought the NFT can access a special page where they can watch videos/read books/listen to audiobooks. Or, if these are open (which most probably are, stored on IPFS), we could allow early birds to download the files and watch/read it offline. (Remember, itâ€™s gonna get pirated anyways, so downloading PDF doesnâ€™t need to be encrypted PDF or something). After early access, those people can still buy the NFT after general announcement, for other kinds of benefits. Then, people can read the content (and download the book) for free. ***What, you live on barely 5 dollars per day? Itâ€™s okay, forget about the 50+ USD textbooks that are non-affordable, we are free!***

### Additional Benefits

Owners of NFT also owns other benefits, depending on what author provides. For example, taken from learning platform EdX and Pluralsight, you can learn the content for free, but you pay to earn a certificate. Similarly, the certificate could be an NFT, and only owners whom subscribe for an NFT are eligible to take the exam. Or perhaps like language learning platforms, you could learn for free, but access to 1:1 teachings from professionals require payment. Here, owner of NFTs are eligible for 1:1 teachings. Whether or not to have tiers of NFT (like Common, Rare, Legendary) are optional depending on what the author provides. ***As information get unlocked, people earn by paying for othersâ€™ time and effort***.

### Extra Time for 1 on 1 (1:1)

Maybe still in a locking sense, people get access to the general book; but to access to authorâ€™s experiences on specific problems, whether by asking them 1:1 or author creates another handbook for that, requires an NFT. Itâ€™s what you noticed (â€œexperienceâ€ or â€œextra informationâ€) that makes you stand out of the crowd. While people more willingly share basic information, these stuffs that makes you stand out are more closed; and it makes sense for NFT holders to buy these experiences so author are more willing to share their expertise on specific problems. ***Basic information are free, while problem-specific experiences are what makes the differences***.

> Experiences can mean what you deliberately noticed. Read smartcuts Chapter 5 â€œWavesâ€ for more information.
>
> [https://openlibrary.org/works/OL17900734W/Smartcuts_how_hackers_innovators_and_icons_accelerate_success?edition=ia%3Asmartcutshowhack0000snow](https://openlibrary.org/works/OL17900734W/Smartcuts_how_hackers_innovators_and_icons_accelerate_success?edition=ia%3Asmartcutshowhack0000snow)


### Access to Discussion/Club/DAO

Or perhaps people get access to discussions. For example, some people doesnâ€™t agree with what the book said, and they have their own saying. If the book have a â€œdiscussionâ€ tab, NFT holders could commit their ideas. Together, they could update the book (with or without the author) to include stuffs the author missed, not aware of, or perhaps other discussions viewpoints. These could be open or closed, and NFT holders might, together with the author, release a v2 edition of the book after some issues not previously aware of in v1 edition are solved. Then, after v2 edition releases, those holding NFTs can get a split of whatâ€™s earned based on their contributions. ***NFT holders are like DAO members, where the DAO is that specific book rather than a general guild/group/community.***

> Though, whether or not this will â€œinflict some damageâ€ to the author is worth discussing. As in, does the author wants people to make change to their content? Or author have other concerns?

These are just a few. Who knows if you discover the next innovative solution?

## Conclusion

In conclusion, as information goes public, as gatekeepers fail to keep information behind gates, itâ€™s time to re-think what we sell. Instead of selling information, one could sell benefits that only book collectors have access to. Ultimately, we aim at provide access to correct, trustworthy information to the general public without worrying about money. We are both a library and a bookseller. People can choose to â€œborrowâ€ it from the library (read it for free), or they can â€œbuyâ€ a book that they read and goes into their shelf (collect an NFT) (with more benefits than just collecting, perhaps).

So, itâ€™s time to re-think.

## Extra: Why a Bookseller on Web3?

You may have noticed the hints one wrote while reading. First, one tries to sell book on Gumroad, unsuccessfully, because one cannot be paid by PayPal. Then, one tries to sell book on Amazon, and how dark is oneâ€™s face when one saw one could only earn 35% out of oneâ€™s book! Given the difficulty of being paid, itâ€™s time to move to cryptocurrency.

Initially, web3 comes as a side-product of these motivations. After starting oneâ€™s own development, one discovered lots of potential and drawbacks that, either we head butt through them, slicing through all the obstacles thatâ€™s on the way to get what we want from the beginning; or we re-think what we want. Honestly, one donâ€™t have the grit to head butt through, nor is one sure that head butt is the right solution; rethinking them seems to fare better, and perhaps provide a brighter future solution.

title: HASH DAO ($HASH) Whitepaper
body:
*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission : Our mission is to cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.**

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution forÂ craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOCÂ communitiesÂ interested in theÂ cannabis space.

HASHÂ DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of the blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's brand to create the worldâ€™s first Web3 Cannabis brand and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAOÂ Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**

A successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal integrity struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

> *Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space*

**Solution**

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

**Introduction**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering itâ€™s boom phase as more global cannabis markets arise and support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) continues to grow support, in 2020 alone the cannabis space grew to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway.

The majority of the craft cannabis space, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the patient, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often donâ€™t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Current Stakeholders in the Cannabis Space :

* The Growers & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**HIGHLIGHT FRESH FROZEN PROBLEM**

![Exclusive Libraries of Genetics & Phenos](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-8T4OrLTcNOJxW2vLerl-.jpg?height=1866&width=1536)

*Solution?* Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKUâ€™s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO.

**DERO Data Privacy** **+ Tokenization of Security**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)**

**Worldâ€™s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

> **HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M6C2p0sNHx37p783TEv9D.jpg?height=822&width=1125)

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> â€œCommunity Ownership of Physical and Digital Assetsâ€

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

* Consumers & Community

title: HASH DAO ($HASH) Whitepaper
body:
*Updated : May 2022*

**Mission : Our mission is to cultivate Web3 community horticulture for the future of the cannabis space.**

HASH DAO provides the first unified DAO solution forÂ craft cannabis farmers, industry professionals, investors, and BIPOCÂ communitiesÂ interested in theÂ cannabis space.

HASHÂ DAO has been created to allow integration into the emerging technologies of the blockchain and Web3 into the cannabis space. Focusing on farmers who put the plant first and under represented communities. To do this, we start by partnering with Uncle Mac's brand to create the worldâ€™s first Web3 Cannabis brand and community tooling of horticulture. Building a growing compilation of automation protocols using smart contracts, HASH DAOÂ Governance seeks to be the future industry standard.

**Problem**

A successful craft cannabis brand with artisanal integrity struggles to navigate the extractive nature of the traditional corporate company structure. Typically the capital solutions available often compromise the integrity and quality of the products at the expense of the small brands reputation, consumers, and the Earth. 

Malpractice and gatekeeping of the cannabis industry has traditionally maximized profits at the cost of the plant or people, and in turn have provided barriers to entry to craft cannabis farmers and the BIPOC community.

> *Barriers of Entry + (Profit > People) = Current State of the Cannabis Space*

**Solution**

Merging Web3 technologies with the cannabis space and creating decentralized and democratized opportunities for companies to raise capital.

**Introduction**

The multi-billion dollar cannabis industry is entering itâ€™s boom phase as support for [U.S. federal legalization](https://www.congress.gov/bill/117th-congress/house-bill/3617) to grow and global cannabis markets continue to come online. The cannabis space is estimated to grow to over [$200 Billion by 2030](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220203005879/en/Global-Cannabis-Market-Size-Forecast-Report-2021-A-176-Billion-by-2030---Growing-Legalization-of-Medical-Cannabis-in-Various-Countries-Driving-Growth---ResearchAndMarkets.com--) as predicted by Berkshire Hathaway. The majority of the craft cannabis industry, lacks in metrics and does not reward innovation or intellectual property; often operating at the cost of the consumer, plant and the planet.

Cancerous pesticides, mold, and in-organic genetically modified flowers have all been out-dated practices utilized in current cannabis horticulture. This is largely due to a profit-driven model of the medicinal plant which has unjustly fined small legacy growers. Incarceration of marginalized communities for alternative medicine use at a disproportionate rate has since gate-kept entry into the space.

Farming, hash-processing, and cannabis tech are often driven to innovation by financial corporate investors, many times leaving most of the developers, designers, and legacy growers at the short end of the intellectual property stick. Elite genetics are identified by farmers through years of R/D sorting through phenotypes of each strain. Many times big brands exploit years of hard work and value that passionate master growers put in and often donâ€™t receive proper credit. Certain strains go on to become cultural identities that generate massive value, I.E. the creators and farmers innovate and the investors profit off their intellectual property, currently there is no on-chain authentication process.

Current Stakeholders in the Cannabis Space :

* The Growers & Phenotype Hunters
* Cannabis Processing & Technology
* Dispensaries & Deliveries
* Consumers & Community
* Mother Earth

Although track-and-trace is currently implemented, most cannabis brands are not completely transparent with their grow methods and techniques of production. There is also massive risk for current cannabis businesses as they have become targets for robberies the past few years. Legal brands are facing counterfeits and knock-offs in the black market. With the integration of digital identities, NFTs/Web3 purchasing, and automation, many of these problems are easily solved.

**HIGHLIGHT FRESH FROZEN PROBLEM**

![Exclusive Libraries of Genetics & Phenos](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/-8T4OrLTcNOJxW2vLerl-.jpg?height=1866&width=1536)

*Solution?* Highly Autonomous Systems of Horticulture (**$HASH**) : Utilizing smart contracts to automate and democratize production, supply chain, and governance in the cannabis & psychedelic industry.

Creating community-ownership of the vertically-integrated $HASH Supply Chain of production, processing, distributing, and operating on-chain craft cannabis  compliance geared toward Web3 adoption. Information, data security, and their applications are essential for business optimization and transparency. Although there are many ERP solutions for the industry already, our governance will be centered around cannabis supply chain and DeFi dApps that utilize NFT-based SKUâ€™s to generate active product data and create on-chain interactions that comply with ESG metrics, paving the way for global regulations and the future of the cannabis space.

Developing Horticulture Public Goods : BIPOC Horticulture Initiative, Open-Source Library of Genetics, Strains and Phenos, Regenerative Farming Methods & Techniques, Cannabis Production, Processing, Entheogenic Cultivation, Medicinal Protocols, and a Community-Practitioner Directory

Community-Governance over the liquidity, yield-farming, and major-user decisions in the tokenization of HASH DAO.

**DERO Data Privacy** **+ Tokenization of Security**

HASH DAO Governance is the future of the industry standard, and to do this we will start by partnering with one successful Emerald Triangle, Northern California craft cannabis-brand with community-staking of its future scaling of operations and expanding a compilation of automation protocols through smart contracts.

**ON-CHAIN SUPPLY NFTs + ACTIVE INVENTORY TRACKING + CRYPTO TRANSACTIONS = Web3 Point of Sale (PoS)**

**Worldâ€™s First Cannabis DAO Founded On**:

BIPOC-equity and engineered around community-development governed by craft cannabis operators, backed by IRL projects.

**On-Chain Protocols + Smart Contracts = The Automated Horticulture of Tomorrow**

Creating a future:

* Geared to the love and cultivation of the plant and Mother Earth
* Onboarding BIPOC leaders and creatives onto the blockchain
* Compensating intellectual property proportionally to fulfill smart contracts

> **HASH DAO = Power Back in Your Hands**

Reinvention of the Horticulture Supply Chain and Data Distribution via smart contracts that allow for automation and help individuals to create ownership over community-led projects, intellectual property, digital assets, and dApps.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/M6C2p0sNHx37p783TEv9D.jpg?height=822&width=1125)

**First Wins for HASH DAO**

> â€œCommunity Ownership of Physical and Digital Assetsâ€

Minting a multi-tiered HASH DAO NFT with the top governance tier going for $10 K, raising a total of $11.5 M for an initial $HASH treasury. As funds become available, proceeds will immediately go to partnering with South Face Mangement to purchase over 30 acres in Mendocino and 40+ acres Humbolt County. This will include the scaling of a vertically-integrated nursery, farm, hash processing, and soon-to-launch retail of award-winning legacy products under Uncle Macâ€™s brand and South Face Farms Management.

**Project #1 :**  Carry out renovation on the farm and nursery to ensure full-scale ESG-metric compliance and how to bring all aspects of the farm and itâ€™s production on-chain, from SKU NFTâ€™s to utilizing energy consumption data for carbon credit checks. Partnering with Uncle Macâ€™s, a Northern California craft cannabis brand, & South Face Management, parent company to Flower Wheel Nursery, South Face Farms Cultivation, and Uncle Macâ€™s brand.

**Project #2 :** Onboard visual and 3D artists who will design branding and assets for the Metaverse and we develop cross-chain NFTâ€™s to be dropped on various play-to-earn games. We will also be acquiring digital plots of real estate to build â€œMetaverse farmsâ€ and â€œdigital dispensariesâ€ where a user can view the product, find out all of itâ€™s information, and have it eventually delivered through an on-chain transaction. Along with digital land we will also be investing in domain names, including various strain names, cannabis celebrities, and psychedelic culture. Explore liquidity pools and yield farming with assets and treasury.

**Project #3 :** For the third project, weâ€™ll be launching Uncle Mac's HASH House is an Emerald Triangle legacy project. This on-chain Hash House is the home lab for Uncle Macâ€™s production. We will also operate as a wholesale fresh frozen supply chain solution for transportation, storage, distribution and hash toll processing throughout the greater Emerald Triangle area.

**Project #4** : Getting $HASH in your hands. This is our farm-to-table craft cannabis buyers club providing direct-to-consumer access to exclusive SKUâ€™s from legacy brands in the Emerald Triangle. This will include obtaining a retail and event license to launch Nephewâ€™s Automated.

**Project #5 :** Aggregating a library of horticulture public goods & building the Biodiversity BIPOC Glamping Learning Initiative; start building Marijuana for Minorities ProgramÂ to co-create $HASH University creating content with some of the best small-batch growers and washers in the industry. (Community Online Education)

**Project #6 :** Nephewâ€™s will be applying for its event space license building the foundation for Akasha, an immersive psychedelic A/R Lounge for BIPOC community healing. The distribution and delivery will be a warehouse that will have an on-chain ESG-metric system in the back and a public access immersive art space in the front. We will also be looking into developing a portfolio of boutique cannabis bud and breakfasts in emerging global cannabis markets.

**Project #7 :** We will be finding ERP solutions to develop state-of-the-art horticulture automation and Web3 technologies, based upon on-chain governance and compliance, to pave the way for the international industry standard by working towards meeting ESG-metric compliance. Our final goal is developing complete automation systems without compromising craft horticulture. From driverless deliveries, farm drone surveillance & data collection to utilize machine-learning and AI and to understand buyer behavior, horticulture improvements, growth optimization, etc.

**Opportunity**

title: Japan passes bill to limit stablecoin issuance to banks and trust companies
body:
Japan is moving forward with legislation regarding the issuance of stablecoins, i.e., digital assets with their value pegged to fiat currencies or stabilized by an algorithm.Â 

On Friday, Japanâ€™s parliament passed a bill to ban stablecoin issuance by non-banking institutions, local news agency Nikkei [reported](https://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXZQOUB081GK0Y2A500C2000000/).Â 

The bill reportedly stipulates that the issuance of stablecoins is limited to licensed banks, registered money transfer agents and trust companies in Japan.

The new legislation also introduces a registration system for financial institutions to issue such digital assets and provides measures against money laundering.

According to the report, the bill aims to protect investors and the financial system from risks associated with the rapid adoption of stablecoins, which saw its market surging up to 20 trillion yen, or more than $150 billion.

The new legal framework will reportedly take effect in 2023, with Japanâ€™s Financial Services Agency planning to [introduce](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2022-06-03/japan-passes-stablecoin-bill-that-enshrines-investor-protection) regulations for stablecoin issuers in the coming months.

***Related: â€‹â€‹[UK government proposes additional safeguards against stablecoin failure risks](https://cointelegraph.com/news/uk-government-proposes-additional-safeguards-against-stablecoin-failure-risks)***

Japanâ€™s stablecoin bill comes in the aftermath of a massive decline on cryptocurrency markets fueled by the Terra tokens collapse, with the algorithmic stablecoin Terra USD (UST) [losing its 1:1 value](https://cointelegraph.com/news/terra-peg-mechanism-in-doubt-as-ust-crashes-to-67-cents) to the U.S. dollar in early May.

The stablecoin market turmoil has not been exclusive to the Terra blockchain as otherÂ [algorithmicÂ stablecoins like DEI](https://cointelegraph.com/news/deus-finance-s-dollar-pegged-stablecoin-dei-falls-below-60-cents) also subsequently lost its dollar peg, [plummeting](https://www.coingecko.com/en/coins/dei-token) to as low as $0.4 in late May.

title: New York AG warns against crypto investments amid state push to ban mining
body:
As New York pursues efforts to ban proof-of-work (PoW) crypto mining, the attorney general reminded investors of the risks associated with investing in crypto.Â 

In an investor alert [published](https://ag.ny.gov/press-release/2022/investor-alert-attorney-general-james-warns-new-yorkers-about-cryptocurrency) Thursday, New York Attorney General Letitia James said that investors are â€œlosing billionsâ€ in crypto. James highlighted that even digital assets that are well-known and traded in reputable exchanges can crash. Because of this, the attorney general is convinced that crypto investments create â€œmore pain than gainâ€ for investors.

Apart from this, James urged New Yorkers to take extra caution when putting their money into crypto. Because of its volatility, the attorney general said that these investments may become a source of anxiety instead of a fortune.

The published alert also highlighted several factors to discourage investors, including the unpredictability of the market, difficulties in cashing out, high transaction costs and the [instability of some stablecoins](https://cointelegraph.com/news/untethered-here-s-everything-you-need-to-know-about-terrausd-tether-and-other-stablecoins). The announcement also reminded investors that many digital currencies are unregulated.

The alert came as the New York State Senate [passed a bill banning PoW mining](https://cointelegraph.com/news/new-york-state-senate-passes-bitcoin-mining-moratorium) within the state. If the bill gets approved by Governor Kathy Hochul, new mining operations will be prohibited, and those with licenses to operate will not be able to renew their permits.

***Related: [US energy company opens crypto mining facility in Middle East to use stranded natural gas](https://cointelegraph.com/news/us-energy-company-opens-crypto-mining-facility-in-middle-east-to-use-stranded-natural-gas)***

Meanwhile, Kenya-based energy company KenGen called on Bitcoin ([BTC](https://cointelegraph.com/bitcoin-price)) miners to [purchase its excess renewable energy](https://cointelegraph.com/news/kenyan-energy-company-entices-bitcoin-miners-with-geothermal-power). According to an executive at the company, there is lots of space within the country and they are eager to welcome miners.

As the bear market continues, BTC [mining revenue is also showing a downward trend](https://cointelegraph.com/news/bitcoin-daily-mining-revenue-slumped-in-may-to-eleven-month-low). On May 24, the daily mining revenue recorded a new eleven-month low of $22.43 million. This is almost half of what was recorded at the start of May 1, which was $40.57 million.
